$MODE_OP.name: $MODE_OP
$MODE_OP.description: Current operating mode of the robot controller (T1, T2, AUT, EX)

C_SPL.name: C_SPL
C_SPL.description: Approximation for Spline Motions (SLIN, SPTP, SCIRC). Uses $APO.CPTP/CDIS/CVEL/CORI settings or parameters.

C_DIS.name: C_DIS
C_DIS.description: Distance approximation. Robot approximates the point by distance.

C_PTP.name: C_PTP
C_PTP.description: PTP approximation. Robot approximates the point by percentage of max axis angle.

C_VEL.name: C_VEL
C_VEL.description: Velocity approximation. Robot approximates the point by maintaining velocity.

$POS_ACT.name: $POS_ACT
$POS_ACT.description: Actual Cartesian position of the robot TCP in the current coordinate system

$BASE.name: $BASE
$BASE.description: Base coordinate system in relation to the world coordinate system in the `ADVANCE` run.

$ROBROOT.name: $ROBROOT
$ROBROOT.description: Robot root position relative to WORLD coordinate system

$WORLD.name: $WORLD
$WORLD.description: World coordinate system (reference for all other frames)

$VEL.name: $VEL
$VEL.description: Current velocity settings: CP (Cartesian path velocity mm/s), ORI1, ORI2 (orientation velocities)

$ACC.name: $ACC
$ACC.description:
Accelerations in the `ADVANCE` run
Unit: m/s^2^

$NULLFRAME.name: $NULLFRAME
$NULLFRAME.description: Zero frame constant {X 0, Y 0, Z 0, A 0, B 0, C 0}

$IN.name: $IN[]
$IN.description: Digital input signals array. $IN[n] reads input n (1-4096)

$OUT.name: $OUT[]
$OUT.description: Digital output signals array. $OUT[n] reads/writes output n (1-4096)

$TIMER.name: $TIMER[]
$TIMER.description: Timer array (1-32). Values in milliseconds. Use $TIMER_STOP[] to control

$TIMER_STOP.name: $TIMER_STOP[]
$TIMER_STOP.description: Timer stop flags. TRUE = timer stopped, FALSE = timer running

$STOPMESS.name: $STOPMESS
$STOPMESS.description: TRUE if a stop message is active (error or interrupt)

$BWDSTART.name: $BWDSTART
$BWDSTART.description: TRUE if backward motion (BCO run) is starting

$CIRC_TYPE.name: $CIRC_TYPE
$CIRC_TYPE.description: Orientation control with CIRC blocks in the `ADVANCE` run

$ORI_TYPE.name: $ORI_TYPE
$ORI_TYPE.description: Current orientation interpolation type (VAR, CONSTANT, JOINT)

$ADVANCE.name: $ADVANCE
$ADVANCE.description:
Specification of the `ADVANCE` run.
Constraint: [0,5]
Unit: motion blocks

$A4PAR.name: $A4PAR
$A4PAR.description:
Set axis 4 parallel to the last rotational main axis
Constraint: `0` when unset. `1` when set

$ABS_ACCUR.name: $ABS_ACCUR
$ABS_ACCUR.description:
Switch absolutely accurate robot model on/off
Constraint: `true` when switched `on`. `false` when switched `off`

$ABS_CONVERT.name: $ABS_CONVERT
$ABS_CONVERT.description: Conversion of point coordinates into absolutely accurate robot model

$ACC_ACT_MA.name: $ACC_ACT_MA
$ACC_ACT_MA.description:
Limit value of axial command acceleration
Constraint: [0,100]
Unit: %

$ACC_AXIS[].name: $ACC_AXIS[]
$ACC_AXIS[].description:
Acceleration of the axes `A1..A6` in the `ADVANCE` run
Constraint: [0,100]
Unit: %

$ACC_AXIS_C[].name: $ACC_AXIS_C[]
$ACC_AXIS_C[].description:
Acceleration of the axes `A1..A6` in the `MAIN` run
Constraint: [0,100]
Unit: %

$ACC_C.name: $ACC_C
$ACC_C.description:
Accelerations in the `MAIN` run
Constraint: \> 0
Unit: m/s^2^

$ACC_CAR_ACT.name: $ACC_CAR_ACT
$ACC_CAR_ACT.description:
The current values of the acceleration components and the total acceleration
Constraint: \>= 0
Unit: m/s^2^

$ACC_CAR_LIMIT.name: $ACC_CAR_LIMIT
$ACC_CAR_LIMIT.description:
Maximum permissible value for the acceleration components and the total acceleration
Constraint: \>= 0
Unit: m/s^2^

$ACC_CAR_MAX.name: $ACC_CAR_MAX
$ACC_CAR_MAX.description: Saves the greatest absolute values of `<xref:$ACC_CAR_ACT>`

$ACC_CAR_STOP.name: $ACC_CAR_STOP
$ACC_CAR_STOP.description:
Activates/Deactivates stop reaction when the value specified in `<xref:$ACC_CAR_LIMIT>` is exceeded.
Constraint: `true` when stop reaction is `activated`. `false` stop reaction is `deactivated`.

$ACC_CAR_TOOL.name: $ACC_CAR_TOOL
$ACC_CAR_TOOL.description: A point on the tool mounted on the robot at which the current effective acceleration is measured

$ACC_EXTAX[].name: $ACC_EXTAX[]
$ACC_EXTAX[].description:
Acceleration of the external axes `E1..E7` in the `ADVANCE` run
Constraint: [0,100]
Unit: %

$ACC_EXTAX_C[].name: $ACC_EXTAX_C[]
$ACC_EXTAX_C[].description:
Acceleration of the external axes `E1..E7` in the `MAIN` run
Constraint: [0,100]
Unit: %

$ACC_MA.name: $ACC_MA
$ACC_MA.description:
Maximum values for path, swivel and rotational accelerations
Unit: m/s^2^

$ACC_OV.name: $ACC_OV
$ACC_OV.description:
Data for acceleration with changes of override
Unit: m/s^2^

$ACT_BASE.name: $ACT_BASE
$ACT_BASE.description:
Number of the current BASE system
Unit: index

$ACT_EX_AX.name: $ACT_EX_AX
$ACT_EX_AX.description:
Number of the current external base kinematic system
Unit: index

$ACT_TOOL.name: $ACT_TOOL
$ACT_TOOL.description:
Number of the current tool coordinate system
Unit: index

$ACT_VAL_DIF.name: $ACT_VAL_DIF
$ACT_VAL_DIF.description:
Maximum permissible difference of encoder actual values when switching on system.
Unit: increments

$ALARM_STOP.name: $ALARM_STOP
$ALARM_STOP.description:
Specification of the `ADVANCE` run.
Constraint: [0,5]
Unit: motion blocks

$APO_DIS_PTP[].name: $APO_DIS_PTP[]
$APO_DIS_PTP[].description:
Maximum approximation distance for `PTP` motions.
Unit: `mm` or `°`

$ASYNC_AX.name: $ASYNC_AX
$ASYNC_AX.description: Motion input for asynchronous external axes `E1..E6`, `negative` or `positive` direction.

$ASYNC_AXi_M.name: $ASYNC_AXi_M
$ASYNC_AXi_M.description: Motion input for asynchronous external axes `E1..E6`, `negative` direction

$ASYNC_AXi_P.name: $ASYNC_AXi_P
$ASYNC_AXi_P.description: Motion input for asynchronous external axes `E1..E6`, `positive` direction

$ASYNC_AXIS.name: $ASYNC_AXIS
$ASYNC_AXIS.description:
Bit arrays to switch external axes to asynchronous mode
Constraint: |

$ASYNC_FLT.name: $ASYNC_FLT
$ASYNC_FLT.description:
Filter for asynchronous external axes
Constraint: [0,16]
Unit: ms

$ASYNC_MODE.name: $ASYNC_MODE
$ASYNC_MODE.description:
Mode for asynchronous external axes
Constraint: [0,16]
Unit: ms

$ASYNC_OPT.name: $ASYNC_OPT
$ASYNC_OPT.description: Option flag for *asynchronous axes are possible*

$ASYNC_T1_FAST.name: $ASYNC_T1_FAST
$ASYNC_T1_FAST.description:
Control of the velocity reduction factor in `Test 1` mode
Constraint: [0,1]

$AUX_POWER.name: $AUX_POWER
$AUX_POWER.description: Signal declaration for external power supply

$AXIS_BACK.name: $AXIS_BACK
$AXIS_BACK.description: Start position of the current motion block, axis-specific

$AXIS_DIR[].name: $AXIS_DIR[]
$AXIS_DIR[].description:
Direction of rotation for axis `A1..A6` and external axis `E1..E6`
Constraint: {-1; 1}

$AXIS_FOR.name: $AXIS_FOR
$AXIS_FOR.description: Target position of the current motion block, axis-specific

$AXIS_HOME[].name: $AXIS_HOME[]
$AXIS_HOME[].description: Definition of the various home positions

$AXIS_INC.name: $AXIS_INC
$AXIS_INC.description:
Incremental actual values of the axes
Unit: increment

$AXIS_INT.name: $AXIS_INT
$AXIS_INT.description: Robot position at the time of an interrupt

$AXIS_RESO[].name: $AXIS_RESO[]
$AXIS_RESO[].description:
Resolution of the position sensing system
Unit: increments / revolution

$AXIS_RET.name: $AXIS_RET
$AXIS_RET.description: Axis positions when leaving the programmed path, axis-specific

$AXIS_SEQ[].name: $AXIS_SEQ[]
$AXIS_SEQ[].description: Change in sequence of axis ... to axis ...

$AXWORKSPACE[].name: $AXWORKSPACE[]
$AXWORKSPACE[].description:
Definition of axis-specific workspace monitoring
Constraint: [1,8]

$BASE_C.name: $BASE_C
$BASE_C.description: Base coordinate system in relation to the world coordinate system in the `MAIN` run

$BOUNCE_TIME.name: $BOUNCE_TIME
$BOUNCE_TIME.description:
Bounce time for EMT signals
Unit: ms

$BRAKE_SIG.name: $BRAKE_SIG
$BRAKE_SIG.description:
Bit array for axis `A1..A6` and external axis `E1..E6` brakes
Constraint: {0,1}

$BRK_DEL_COM.name: $BRK_DEL_COM
$BRK_DEL_COM.description:
Time after which the axis brakes are closed on completion of positioning during jogging
Unit: ms

$BRK_DEL_EX.name: $BRK_DEL_EX
$BRK_DEL_EX.description:
Brake delay time for external axes
Unit: ms

$BRK_DEL_PRO.name: $BRK_DEL_PRO
$BRK_DEL_PRO.description:
Time after which the axis brakes are closed on completion of posi- tioning in the program
Unit: ms

$BRK_MAX_TM.name: $BRK_MAX_TM
$BRK_MAX_TM.description:
Maximum deceleration time for path-maintaining Emergency Stop
Unit: ms

$BRK_MODE.name: $BRK_MODE
$BRK_MODE.description:
Brake control mode
Constraint: Bbbbb
Unit: bit array

$BRK_OPENTM.name: $BRK_OPENTM
$BRK_OPENTM.description:
Time delay of command value output after axis brakes have been opened
Unit: ms

$CAL_DIFF.name: $CAL_DIFF
$CAL_DIFF.description: Mastering difference for EMT mastering with check run

$CALP.name: $CALP
$CALP.description: Reference point offset between mathematical zero point and encoder zero point

$CIRC_TYPE_C.name: $CIRC_TYPE_C
$CIRC_TYPE_C.description: Orientation control with CIRC blocks in the `MAIN` run

$CMD.name: $CMD
$CMD.description: Display assignment number (handle) for command channel

$COM_NAME.name: $COM_NAME
$COM_NAME.description: Command which is to be processed after next start

$COM_VAL_MI[].name: $COM_VAL_MI[]
$COM_VAL_MI[].description: Limitation of command speed for axis `A1..A6` and external axis `E1..E6`

$CP_VEL_TYPE.name: $CP_VEL_TYPE
$CP_VEL_TYPE.description: Reduction of the CP path velocity

$CPVELREDMELD.name: $CPVELREDMELD
$CPVELREDMELD.description: Generation of message if path velocity reduced

$CURR_ACT[].name: $CURR_ACT[]
$CURR_ACT[].description:
Actual current of axes
Constraint: [-100,100]
Unit: %

$CURR_CAL[].name: $CURR_CAL[]
$CURR_CAL[].description: Current calibration of axis in the power module

$CURR_COM_EX[].name: $CURR_COM_EX[]
$CURR_COM_EX[].description: Current limitation for external axes in jog mode

$CURR_MAX[].name: $CURR_MAX[]
$CURR_MAX[].description:
Maximum effective current on power module output
Unit: A

$CURR_RED[,].name: $CURR_RED[,]
$CURR_RED[,].description: Current limitation for axes in `%` of the maximum current

$CYC_DEFi[].name: $CYC_DEFi[]
$CYC_DEFi[].description: Input text for the corresponding cyclical flag

$PRO_MODE0.name: $PRO_MODE0
$PRO_MODE0.description: Program run mode of the `SUBMIT` interpreter

$PRO_MODE1.name: $PRO_MODE1
$PRO_MODE1.description: Program run mode of the `ROBOT` interpreter

AXIS.name: AXIS
AXIS.description: Axis structure for 6-axis robots. Contains joint angles for axes A1-A6.

fields.A1: Joint angle for axis 1 in degrees
fields.A2: Joint angle for axis 2 in degrees
fields.A3: Joint angle for axis 3 in degrees
fields.A4: Joint angle for axis 4 in degrees
fields.A5: Joint angle for axis 5 in degrees
fields.A6: Joint angle for axis 6 in degrees

E6AXIS.name: E6AXIS
E6AXIS.description: Extended axis structure for 6-axis robots with external axes. Contains A1-A6 for robot joints and E1-E6 for external axes.

fields.A1: Joint angle for axis 1 in degrees
fields.A2: Joint angle for axis 2 in degrees
fields.A3: Joint angle for axis 3 in degrees
fields.A4: Joint angle for axis 4 in degrees
fields.A5: Joint angle for axis 5 in degrees
fields.A6: Joint angle for axis 6 in degrees
fields.E1: External axis 1 position (linear in mm or rotary in degrees)

FRAME.name: FRAME
FRAME.description: Geometric frame structure defining a coordinate system. Contains Cartesian position (X, Y, Z) and orientation angles (A, B, C).

POS.name: POS
POS.description: Position structure with Cartesian coordinates, orientation, and robot configuration. Adds Status (S) and Turn (T) to FRAME.

fields.S: Status byte - defines arm configuration (bit 0: basic/overhead, bit 1: arm config, bit 2: wrist config)
fields.T: Turn byte - defines axis rotation direction (bit n: axis n+1 angle < 0)

E6POS.name: E6POS
E6POS.description: Extended position structure with Cartesian coordinates, orientation, robot configuration, and external axes. Most commonly used position type.

fields.S: Status byte - defines arm configuration (bit 0: basic/overhead, bit 1: arm config, bit 2: wrist config)
fields.T: Turn byte - defines axis rotation direction (bit n: axis n+1 angle < 0)
fields.E1: External axis 1 position (linear in mm or rotary in degrees)

STATUS.name: STATUS
STATUS.description: Robot arm configuration status (S parameter in POS/E6POS). 3-bit value defining the robot pose.

bits.Bit 0: Position of wrist root point (0 = basic area, 1 = overhead area)
bits.Bit 1: Arm configuration (0 = elbow up, 1 = elbow down)
bits.Bit 2: Wrist configuration (0 = wrist not flipped, 1 = wrist flipped)

TURN.name: TURN
TURN.description: Axis rotation direction indicator (T parameter in POS/E6POS). 6-bit value indicating which axes have negative angles.

SIGNAL.name: SIGNAL
SIGNAL.description: A signal defines and alias to one or several IN/OUT

ACC_CAR.name: ACC_CAR
ACC_CAR.description: Frame data structure with an additional magnitude field.

KrlMsgDlgSK_T.name: KrlMsgDlgSK_T
KrlMsgDlgSK_T.description: Softkey data structure for dialog message

MODE_OP.name: MODE_OP
MODE_OP.description: Operating mode of the robot controller

values.T1: Test mode 1 - Manual reduced velocity (max 250 mm/s)
values.T2: Test mode 2 - Manual at programmed velocity (100%)
values.EX: Automatic External mode - Controlled by PLC/external system

values.ISTEP: Incremental Step - Block-by-block processing with stop after each instruction (no advance run)
values.PSTEP: Program Step - Complete processing of subprograms (no advance run)
values.MSTEP: Motion Step - Step-by-step with stop after each motion instruction (no advance run)
values.CSTEP: Continuous Step - Step-by-step with stop after each motion (with advance run)
values.GO: Continuous execution to the end of the program
values.BSTEP: Backward Step - Continuous execution backwards to program start

values.BUSY: Asynchronous motions active, stopped or temporarily stored
values.IDLE: No asynchronous motions active (queue empty); last motion completed normally
values.CANCELLED: No asynchronous motions active (queue empty); last motion was canceled
values.PEND: Asynchronous motion is planned but not currently executing

AXBOX.name: AXBOX
AXBOX.description: Work envelope monitoring mode for axis-based workspace surveillance

values.INSIDE: Output set if TCP is inside the work envelope
values.OUTSIDE: Output set if TCP is outside the work envelope
values.INSIDE_STOP: Output set AND robot stopped if TCP is inside the work envelope
values.OUTSIDE_STOP: Output set AND robot stopped if TCP is outside the work envelope

SIG_STATE.name: SIG_STATE
SIG_STATE.description: State of the enabling switch (deadman switch)

values.RELEASED: No enabling switch pressed (default) or fully pressed (panic position)
values.PRESSED: One or more enabling switches pressed (enabling position)

CIRC_TYPE.name: CIRC_TYPE
CIRC_TYPE.description: Orientation control type for circular motions (CIRC/SCIRC)

values.BASE: Space-related orientation control - orientation relative to BASE coordinate system
values.PATH: Path-related orientation control - orientation relative to circular path

ORI_TYPE.name: ORI_TYPE
ORI_TYPE.description: Orientation interpolation type during CP motions

values.VAR: Variable orientation with possible reduction of velocity and acceleration
values.CONSTANT: Constant orientation - tool orientation remains unchanged during motion
values.JOINT: Variable orientation without reduction of velocity and acceleration

values.TCP: Interpolation in TCP (Tool Center Point) coordinate system

TARGET_STATUS.name: TARGET_STATUS
TARGET_STATUS.description: Status calculation mode for target point

values.SOURCE: Use Status of the start point
values.BEST: Calculate all eight Status combinations; select shortest path in axis space

AXWMODE.name: AXWMODE
AXWMODE.description: Functional principles for axis-specific workspace monitoring

COSYS.name: COSYS
COSYS.description: Orientation control modes for CIRC blocks

CP_VEL_TYPE.name: CP_VEL_TYPE
CP_VEL_TYPE.description: Reduction modes for CP path velocity

Mode.name: Mode
Mode.description: Functional principle of the axis-specific workspace monitoring function

StrCopy.name: StrCopy
StrCopy.description: Copy the contents of a string variable to another string variable.

parameters.name: strDest[]
parameters.description:
The character string is copied to this string variable.
Since `strDest[]` is an array of type `CHAR`, individual characters and constants are not permissible.

parameters.name: strSource[]
parameters.description: The contents of this string variable are copied.

StrCopy.return-description: Returns `true` if the copy was successfull. Returns `false` otherwise.
StrCopy.comments: The function `StrCopy()` can be used to copy the contents of a string variable to another string variable.

code-sample.krl:
DECL CHAR A[25], B[25]
DECL BOOL C
A[] = ""
B[] = "Example"
C   = StrCopy(A[], B[])

StrClear.name: StrClear
StrClear.description: Delete the content of a string variable.

parameters.name: strVar[]
parameters.description: Variable, whose content should be deleted

StrClear.comments: The function `StrClear()` can be used to delete the content of a string variable.

code-sample.krl:
DECL CHAR string[25]
DECL BOOL ret

string[] = "KUKAROBOTS"
ret   = StrClear(string[])

PTP.name: PTP
PTP.description: Point-to-Point motion. Moves the robot to a point using the fastest path.

LIN.name: LIN
LIN.description: Linear motion. Moves the robot in a straight line to the target point.

CIRC.name: CIRC
CIRC.description: Circular motion. Moves along a circular path via an auxiliary point.

SPTP.name: SPTP
SPTP.description: Spline PTP motion. Smoother, more precise PTP motion (KSS 8.3+).

SLIN.name: SLIN
SLIN.description: Spline Linear motion. Smoother, more precise Linear motion (KSS 8.3+).

BRAKE.name: BRAKE
BRAKE.description: Stops robot motion inside an Interrupt.

HALT.name: HALT
HALT.description: Stops the program execution. Requires Start key to resume.

IF.name: IF
IF.description: Conditional branching. Executes a block if the condition is TRUE.

THEN.name: THEN
THEN.description: Start of the IF block execution branch.

ELSE.name: ELSE
ELSE.description: Alternative branch in an IF block.

TO.name: TO
TO.description: Defines the end value in a FOR loop.

STEP.name: STEP
STEP.description: Defines the increment step in a FOR loop (default 1).

WHILE.name: WHILE
WHILE.description: Loop that repeats as long as the condition is TRUE.

LOOP.name: LOOP
LOOP.description: Infinite loop. Must be exited with EXIT or GOTO.

REPEAT.name: REPEAT
REPEAT.description: Loop that executes at least once and repeats until condition is TRUE.

SWITCH.name: SWITCH
SWITCH.description: Selects a block based on the value of a variable.

CASE.name: CASE
CASE.description: Defines a value branch in a SWITCH block.

DEFAULT.name: DEFAULT
DEFAULT.description: Default branch in a SWITCH block if no CASE matches.

EXIT.name: EXIT
EXIT.description: Exits a loop (FOR, WHILE, LOOP, REPEAT) prematurely.

DECL.name: DECL
DECL.description: Declares a variable, array, or structure.

GLOBAL.name: GLOBAL
GLOBAL.description: Scope modifier: Makes the variable or subprogram accessible from other files.

PUBLIC.name: PUBLIC
PUBLIC.description: Scope modifier: Makes the data list (DEFDAT) accessible.

CONST.name: CONST
CONST.description: Declares a constant value. Must be initialized at declaration.

INT.name: INT
INT.description: Integer data type (32-bit signed). Range: -2^31 to 2^31-1.

REAL.name: REAL
REAL.description: Floating point number (32-bit). Approx 7 digits precision.

BOOL.name: BOOL
BOOL.description: Boolean data type. Values: TRUE, FALSE.

CHAR.name: CHAR
CHAR.description: Character data type. Also used for Strings (Array of CHAR).

FRAME.name: FRAME
FRAME.description: Geometric structure (X, Y, Z, A, B, C).

POS.name: POS
POS.description: Position structure (X, Y, Z, A, B, C, S, T).

DEFFCT.name: DEFFCT
DEFFCT.description: Start of a function definition. Must return a value.

DEFDAT.name: DEFDAT
DEFDAT.description: Start of a data list definition.

END.name: END
END.description: End of a program (DEF) or data list (DEFDAT).

RETURN.name: RETURN
RETURN.description: Returns from a function, optionally with a value.

WAIT.name: WAIT
WAIT.description: Waits for a specific time or condition.

CONTINUE.name: CONTINUE
CONTINUE.description: Prevents the advance run pointer from stopping at the next instruction. Use before I/O or logic.

TRIGGER.name: TRIGGER
TRIGGER.description: Path-triggered logic. Executes a statement at a specific point on the path.

RESUME.name: RESUME
RESUME.description: Aborts the current motion and stack, resuming execution at the level where the interrupt was declared.

SIGNAL.name: SIGNAL
SIGNAL.description: Defines a name for an I/O signal or group of signals.

PULSE.name: PULSE
PULSE.description: Sets an output for a specific duration.

&ACCESS.name: &ACCESS
&ACCESS.description: Defines access rights for the file.

BAS.name: BAS
BAS.description: Basis Technical package initialization and parameter setting.

$STOPMESS.name: $STOPMESS
$STOPMESS.description: System variable indicating a stop message is active (Boolean).

$BWDSTART.name: $BWDSTART
$BWDSTART.description: Flag to indicate backward motion start.

PDAT_ACT.name: PDAT_ACT
PDAT_ACT.description: Active PTP point data structure (Velocity, Accel, Approx).

FDAT_ACT.name: FDAT_ACT
FDAT_ACT.description: Active Frame data structure (Tool, Base, IPO).

LDAT_ACT.name: LDAT_ACT
LDAT_ACT.description: Active LIN/CIRC dat structure (Vel, Acc, Approx).
